data.title: Tesla (TSLA) Stock Moves -0.03%: What You Should Know
data.text: Tesla (TSLA) closed the most recent trading day at $427.53, moving -0.03% from the previous trading session.

data.title: Coronavirus Stock Market Crash: Dark Days Ahead For Apple, Tesla Stock?
data.text: Major stocks, including Apple and Tesla, are facing unprecedented challenges as the coronavirus continues to spread and infect global markets. Daniel Ives, Managing Director of Equity Research at Wedbush Securities, joins IBD to discuss the unique demand issues popular tech companies are facing as the pandemic unfolds.

data.title: Coronavirus Stock Market Crash: Apple, Tesla Stock Brace For Demand Destruction
data.text:
Major stocks, including Apple and Tesla stock, are facing unprecedented challenges as the coronavirus continues to spread and infect global markets.
The post Coronavirus Stock Market Crash: Apple, Tesla Stock Brace For Demand Destruction appeared first on Investor's Business Daily.

data.title: US auto sales decline doubles in last week: JD Power
data.text: CNBC's Phil LeBeau reports that the U.S. auto sales declines have doubled in the last week.

data.title: Tesla's Elon Musk Says He Can Make Ventilators
data.text: Tesla Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk joined General Motors Co. in offering to manufacture hospital ventilators amid the coronavirus outbreak. A Tesla assembly plant also had to idle production. Bloomberg's Ed Ludlow reports on "Bloomberg Technology."

data.title: How Elon Musk took Tesla to hell and back with the Model 3
data.text: Growing Tesla from the Roadster to the Model 3 was a bumpy road, and Wall Street was along for the wild ride. CNBC explores how Tesla and Elon Musk started an electric car revolution.

data.text: The automaker's recent capital raise couldn't have been better timed.

data.title: TSLA Stock Didn’t Catch an Unlucky Break, Its Luck Just Ran Out
data.text: TSLA stock has crashed in the past six weeks due to the COVID-19 outbreak. Investors didn't see the outbreak coming, but that doesn't mean that the Tesla losses are simply bad luck.
